description: Detects when scientific or technical advances are being applied in ways that increase inequality, extraction, or entropy rather than balance and resilience.
signals: Benefits of a discovery disproportionately flow to central powers or corporations
Communities experience increased dependency or vulnerability after adoption
Knowledge is siloed or monetized instead of distributed
risk: Technology framed as 'progress' creates systemic fragility and suppresses long-term resilience.
mitigation: Map who gains/loses across domains when applying knowledge
Test for balance in energy, ecological, and cultural dimensions
Prioritize distributed and regenerative uses of technology
